title: 1, 5, 2, and 3
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(1,5,2,3)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are 4 distinct positive integers such that the sum of 2 of them equals the product of the other 2, and vice versa, i.e. the sum of these 2 other numbers equals the product of the 2 numbers initially mentioned:
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1+5=2\times 3, \quad 2+3=1\times 5."}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Generally spoken, 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b=c\times d, \quad c+d=a\times b."}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Determine the number of un-ordered quadruplets "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a,b,c,d) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" other than "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(1,5,2,3) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" that satisfy this condition."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let a be the smallest of the four numbers. If a >= 2, then ab >= 2b > a + b = cd > c + d. But the problem requires that ab = c + d, so we’ve reached a contradiction. Therefore, a < 2, and since a must be a positive integer, a = 1.
When a = 1, the equation ab = c + d becomes b = c + d, and the equation a + b = cd becomes 1 + b = cd, which is equivalent to b = cd – 1. These results can be combined to give 1 + c + d = cd, which can be rewritten as cd – d – c – 1 = 0, or (c – 1)(d – 1) = 2. This final equation implies that c = 2 and d = 3, or vice versa.So b=5. The only solution is (1,5,2,3), or its combinations."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Consider 2 quadratic equations "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^2-(a+b)x+ab=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^2-(c+d)x+cd=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The second one equates to this: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^2-abx+a+b=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" owing to the property described at the problem. The value of these equations is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a, b, c, d"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" repectively."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a≠b≠c≠d"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the sum of values and the multiple of values should be different each other. (If they are same, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b=d"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":")"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b>ab"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c+d<cd"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Note: of course, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b<ab"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c+d>cd"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is correct. I selected the first case in my solution."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b>ab"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"ab-a-b<0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a-1)(b-1)<1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are positive integers, if they are 2 or more, the inequation has no values."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thus, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" must be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Then the property above is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1+b=cd"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c+d=b=cd-1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"cd-c-d=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(c-1)(d-1)=2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are positive integers, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c=3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d=2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c=2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d=3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Thus, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b=2+3=5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, the possible ordered pair is only "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(1, 5, 2, 3)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and its combinations, and thus the answer is zero(never exist)."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 153 degrees must be a special angle
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Chord "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\text{AB}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" subtends an angle of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"153^{\\circ}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" at the centre "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\text{O}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" of a circle. Point "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\text{P}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the point of trisection of the major arc "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\text{AB}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" closer to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\text{B}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\text{Q}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a point on the minor arc "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\text{AB}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", find in degrees "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\angle \\text{AQP}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/HVS4FshArl-math.PNG?width=1200"}},{"type":"text","text":"
Because "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\angle AOB = 153"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the other side of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\angle AOB = 360 - 153 = 207"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Point "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" trisects the major arc "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"AB"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" thus "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"OP"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" trisects "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\angle AOB"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Therefore "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\angle BOP = 69"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\angle POA = 138"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". By central angle theorem we can tell that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\angle AQP = \frac{1}{2} \angle POA"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\angle AQP = \boxed{69}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The divisibility test for 9 is applicable here (which is glaringly obvious since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 1 \leq 9 \leq 15 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"). "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
The total sum of the digits will be equal to some multiple of 9. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 1 \times ( 1 + 8 + a ) + 2 \times ( 3 + 6 + 7) + 4 \times 0 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is  a multiple of 9. "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
This is equal to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 41 + a "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 0 \leq a \leq 9 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", hence we must have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" a = 4 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to give "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 41 + 4 = 45 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" as the multiple of 9."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Note: "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"orderedList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"15!"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" has "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \lfloor \frac{15}{3} \rfloor + \lfloor \frac{15}{3^2} \rfloor = 5 + 1 = 6 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" factors of 3, so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"15!"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a multiple of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 3^6 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". This approach shows us that even "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 6!, 7!, 8! "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are multiples of 9 even though 9 doesn't appear in the expanded multiplication."}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Note: If the digit sum without "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a multiple of 9, then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" could only be 0 or 9. We will need to do more work."}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Eric's approach would work better for this problem, as we will always get just 1 answer. If more digits were hidden, then we will need more tests.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            That's essentially the logic."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Can you complete the calculation to explain how to arrive at the answer? Thanks!

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"15!"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" has "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\lfloor \frac{15}{2} \rfloor + \lfloor \frac{15}{2^2} \rfloor + \lfloor \frac{15}{2^3} \rfloor = 7 + 3 + 1 = 11"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" factors of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". You can be sure that the last n digits is divisible by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"; for example "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a368000"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is divisible by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a368"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is divisible by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", if the double possibility of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"9"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" arises.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Similar to Saya Suka's solution, but with 11."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let each digits in 130767a368000 have indexes, where the first digit (1) has an index of 1, the second digit (3) has an index of 2, and etc."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The divisibility test for 11 is that the sum of all the digits with even indexes differ from the sum of all the digits with odd indexes by a multiple of 11 
(including 0)."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Sum of digits with odd digits: 
1 + 0  + 6 + a + 6 + 0 + 0 = 13 + a
Sum of digits with even digits: 
3 + 7 + 7 + 3 + 8 + 0 = 28"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"13 + a = 28 + 11n "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
a= 15 + 11n "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
Since a is a digit,  0<= a <= 9. "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
Thus, n = -1 and a = 4"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Nice! The benefit of using the rule of 11 is that we're guaranteed a unique answer no matter which digit is hidden (assuming that all the other digits are correct).

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            I don't think it's an overkill because of how simple the rule is. If we tried to apply divisibility by 17 which doesn't have a real simple use, then that would be an overkill.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            11 might be a bit overkill for this problem, but is the best method in this "},{"type":"text","text":"variation","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":"!

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
